==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|さん|そ|yomi=on}}
{{elements|O|{{ja-r|窒%素|ちっ%そ}}|N|{{ja-r|フッ素|フッそ}}|F|lang=ja|sort=すいそ}}
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology===
{{com|ja|酸|素|tr1=san|t1=[[acid]]|tr2=so|t2=[[element]]|sort=さんそ}}, {{cal|ja|nocap=y|etyl lang=nl|sort=さんそ|etyl term=zuurstof|etyl t=[[oxygen]]; [[sourstuff]]}}. Compare {{cog|de|Sauerstoff}}, {{cog|lb|Sauerstoff}}.

Considered to be used first in [[w:Udagawa Yōan|Udagawa Yōan]]'s (宇田川榕菴, 1798 – 1846) book ''Introduction to Chemistry'' (舎密開宗, ''Seimi Kaisō''), a compilation of various scientific books in Dutch.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|acc=a|y=ko|さんそ}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|さんそ}}

# [[oxygen]] {{gloss|chemical element}}
# [[oxygen]] {{gloss|molecular oxygen}}

* {{l|ja|酸素吸入}} (''sanso kyūnyū''): oxygen inhalation
* {{l|ja|酸素供給}} (''sanso kyōkyū''): oxygen supply
* {{l|ja|酸素欠乏}} (''sanso ketsubō''): oxygen deficiency

* {{l|ja|低酸素脳症}} (''teisanso-nōshō''): hypoxic encephalopathy

* {{l|ja|溶存酸素}} (''yōzon sanso''): dissolved oxygen
* {{l|ja|高圧酸素室}} (''kōatsu-sansoshitsu''): hyperbaric oxygen chamber
* {{l|ja|高圧酸素療法}} (''kōatsu sanso ryōhō''): hyperbaric oxygen therapy
* {{l|ja|化学的酸素要求量}} (''kagakuteki sanso-yōkyūryō''): chemical oxygen demand
